stunts: RIFT RAT MARTIAL ARTIST: Because I’ve developed a dirty, acrobatic unarmed style built for alley-fights, I get +2 when I Defend with Fight against physical attacks from a single foe in my zone, as long as I’m fighting unarmed or with improvised “street” weapons; additionally, once per scene, when I Succeed with Style on that Defend, I may forgo the boost to instead create a situation aspect on the attacker or the scene (your choice) with one free invoke (e.g., Blurred Movement, Cheap Shot, or Manacled).

CLAN GALEWARDEN’S THU’UM: Because I come from a bloodline that trained the Voice, once per scene I get +2 when I use Will to Overcome or Create an Advantage by unleashing a Thu’um (a shout); also, I may use Will instead of Lore when studying, recalling, or learning Words of Power.

RUNNING ON AIR: Because I move fast and silent like a bad omen with good cardio, once per scene I may Create an Advantage with Stealth to become Gale-Runner; if I succeed, I may immediately move up to two zones as part of the same action (instead of the usual one), as long as the route isn’t blocked by a locked-down obstacle or barrier; the Gale-Runner aspect gains free invokes as normal (1 on success, 2 on success with style).

The Art of the Deal: Because Aldric grew up in the courts of Mistveil Keep, ran merchant trade with Brynjolf, and learned business through his family's shipping lines, drafting a deal is second nature. Once per scene, when creating an advantage to set terms on an agreement/arrangement/contract, gain +2 to Rapport. On a Success With Style, create the scene aspect 'Good Business' with 2 free invokes OR forgo those invokes to add one reasonable addendum the other party must concede.

backstory:
**Civil War Entry**: By Shor, I did everythin' in my power to stay out've it. When this damnable war started, Clan Galewarden was the first to heed Ulfric's call. As one of the Eldest families in the Rift, with a legacy cemented in war sullied by wealth and aristocracy! I warned them that none of us had the strength our Ancestor's did! Nor did any of us know a full three-word Thu'um, for we had not honed our birth right as Grandfather had in the Great War.. So when they decided to charge an Imperial battalion uphill, and out numbered, they paid the price. Only I remain now, sat upon crumblin' wealth, and a new family.

**Civil War Stance**: I wouldn't exactly call being in the Thieves Guild a neutral cause. Hm, no. More like the self-interested cause', fact of the matter is, I like coin. Bein' wealthy will do that to ye'. When my family had left Riften to join the Stormcloaks. They abandoned the shippin' industry that was dependent on the Empire's commerce to turn profit! "Victory or Sovrngarde" They Chanted.. More like, "Victory or Bankruptcy" Pah! The only loyalty I owe now is to the Guild, and to me Kin; Brynjolf. The one Lad who never turned his back, even when things got rough..

**Motivation**: Despite the dwindlin' wealth, sold shippin' business, and loss of respect as a man-of-standin'. I plan on gettin' it all back, no matter how many life-or-death situations Vex puts me in! Just because I refused to fight in a war I knew my family was woefully unprepared for, doesn't mean I'm a coward. Hell, I've been in more street-fights than any of em'!Even developed me own version of hand-to-hand combat, footpads in the Ratway have taken to callin' it the Rift Rat Fighting-Style. Can't lie, It's got a ring to it. Other than gettin' me families affairs in order, there's gettin' Brynjolf'sGuild back on it's feet, I owe him that much. Also, I kinda like it. It'd completely destroy what social standin' I have left if any in Mistveil Keep were to find out, but the life of a Thief suits me well. Bryn says I'm a natural. All charm that one. Lastly, as of late. I've been findin' solace in ole tales of the Galewarden's of the past. Me Grandfather was the last one in our family to know over three full words of power, I bet I could beat that. Already a quarter of the way there.

**Connections**: As said, me closest friend is Brynjolf. Even before my families fall, Bryn and I use to run all sorts of mischief together! He was the brain, and the misdirect. I was the silver-tongue, and if it came to it, the brawn. When we weren't swindlin' snake oil, we were runnin' up a tab in the Bee and Barb, or sowin' seeds throughout Riften with some long-termplan Bryn had cooked up. Outside him, Jarl Laila Lawgiver still lends me her ear, she's the only reason I still hold authority. Vekel in the Ratway and I have a Rapport. Of course I'd like to think Sapphire and I are close, but the lass is more close off than the Shrine of Talos in Markarth! Then, there's Mjoll the Lioness. Hah, never has there been a more elegant, and more fierce shield-maiden than she! If she ever found out that I run with the Thieves Guild, well, my affections for her would certainly not be reciprocated, and her good-aligned heart would more than likely see me hung from Mistveil Keep.. Regarding Whiterun, Hm, I have met Vignar Greymane, and Olfrid Battleborn more than a few times, and done buisness with them both. However, it's never been much more than that.

session_notes: S1-01: Zone-in at Whiterun walls. Used Running on Air to create 'Gale-Runner' (2 free invokes). Spent 1 FP to use WULD. Overcame wall with style. Whirlwind Sprint mastery ticked +1 (now 3/8). Gained boost: 'Perched Like a Hawk'.
WHT-04: Exited via balcony, re-entered via rooftop window. Patrol lantern sweep intensified outside.
WHT-05: Skirted along the inner parapet rooftops, scouting guard routes and lining up a path deeper into Whiterun without breaking stealth.
WHT-06: Committed to the rooftop route across the west wall, pressing the advantage from 'Gale-Runner' to stay ahead of patrol lantern sweeps.

WHT-07: Doubled back through a risky rooftop gap, using WULD a second time this session to slip a tightening patrol at the cost of a mild consequence. Left behind the illusionary trail 'Backtracked Mirage' (2 free invokes) to mislead pursuers. Whirlwind Sprint mastery ticked +1 (now 4/8).
SESSION 1 END: Delivered Battle-Born strongbox to Olfrid; obtained sealed note for Hadvar; gold now 645; Ragged Voice recovered; FP set to refresh for next session.

SESSION 1 END: Delivered Battle-Born strongbox to Olfrid; gold now 645; gained sealed note for Hadvar + guard key ring; Ragged Voice cleared; fate points refreshed; Minor Milestone spent to buy stunt 'The Art of the Deal' (refresh 2→1).

SESSION 2: Met Hadvar and Legate Rikke at the west wall muster, presented Olfrid's sealed note to Hadvar (seal opened by Hadvar), assigned to Hadvar's section, requisitioned signal-smoke pots x2 and throwing axes x2 from Imperial quartermaster.
WHT-09: Took compel (Hadvar's Guard Up). Used Art of the Deal to lock public unit claim: Under Hadvar's Banner. Negotiated wager terms with Hadvar.
WHT-09: Used Battle Cry (racial, once/session) to create 'Frightened Enemies' (1 free invoke).
WHT-09: Succeeded with Style on Defend using Rift Rat Martial Artist; created 'Kicked Off the Ladder' (1 free invoke).
WHT-09: Used Running on Air → created Gale-Runner (SWS, 2 free invokes; 1 spent).
WHT-09: Overcame second ladder with Athletics (spent Broken Rhythm boost + Gale-Runner invoke) → ladder toppled; gained boost Left Flank Cleared.
WHT-09: Defended vs Stormcloak veteran with Rift Rat Martial Artist → SWS; gained boost Veteran Off-Balance.
